edu.nps.moves.gateway

Class DisRedis

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nps.moves.gateway.DisRedis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DISEndpoint

    public class DisRedis
extends java.lang.Object
implements DISEndpoint
    Endpoint that forwards to a Redis server. This allows DIS messages to be passed among a back-end cluster of Websocket servers, instead of a single Websocket server.

    The documentation on Jedis is mighty thin. It seems that publish (?) and subscribe actions want to be in their own threads, near as I can figure.

    Since we want only a single DisEndpoint communicating with the redis server, we use a singleton pattern. Use getInstance() to retrieve the single, shared object.

    To prevent loops, in which we send a DIS PDU to the redis server on the publish channel, get it back on the subscribe channel, and then get it looping, lost dutchman style, we prepend a small bit of data at the start of the binary PDU with a randomly generated, very unlikely to be duplicated number. We then discard any messages we receive from the redis server that have our ID.
